intro: [WRONG START] Hieracius subviridans, commonly known as the green hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Native to Europe, it thrives in meadows and grassy areas. The plant produces small, elongated seed heads that release tiny seeds with tufts of hair for wind dispersal. It is often found in disturbed soils and can form dense colonies in suitable habitats.
